title: Everyone with Honor lvl 0 should be banned out of Rankeds
body:
So this is just getting ridicoules,
i had 3 people today who proudly announced that they are honor lvl 0 and bragged aorund that the graves skin sucks anyway and everyone is a %%%got hwo got it. They queue in rankeds just to feed, troll and piss the whole team off with everything from stelaing the cs from the adc as support, to flashing at the beginning of the game.

"The Community has improved" Riot said, like hell it did

replies.body: This would have the effect of creating an even *more* toxic environment in normals via the Prisoner's Island concept. Riot has stated they will not implement anything that would have the result of clustering negativity or toxicity in one place as it would a) be detrimental to those who wanted to play whatever game mode it was put in, and/or b) would be hard to climb out of given the rampant toxicity in the queue, and/or c) would punish those who make one mistake for basically eternity, etc. etc. etc.

I'm confused by what this has to do with the original post. Yes, people might buy and account and smurf after being banned, BUT, if their honor level drops to 0 or is locked at level 1, they shouldn't even be able to PLAY ranked. That's what this is about. So basically, doesn't matter how many accounts you buy, if you're toxic you lose the privilege of playing ranked. As someone above said, you can buy and account, but you can't buy honor.
This would probably not even be a bad idea

There was a time when Riot did exactly that, and the results were terrible: you couldn't play a Normal game without having 3 flamers in your team. 

To give you an idea of the problem, I started to play Ranked to have less flamers in my team. It was that bad.

Let me explain where i see a major problem in this.

The way that riot "detects" people reforming is entirely reliant on the community itself. If you're just an average bloke who doesnt get honored several times a game, you're absolutely, royally, fucked. 

Several months ago i was chat penalized for a first-time offense. A grand total of 10 games of limited chat back in august i believe. 

Since then, i've done my damnedest to try and avoid being the next tyler1, But i'm far from a shining paragon of the human race. I get frusterated, but i avoid taking anger out on fellow teammates. I've been "Honor Unlocked" since about a week or two after the flamefest i got penalized for. 

To put into perspective what it was, i had just started jungling but even then i knew an important part of jungling was ganking lanes and helping teammates in fights. When i faced Lucian and Brand jungles, whom never ganked and flamed me for losing in a hard-countered lane.

So, i got pissed at them for playing poorly and not helping the team, so i flame em. Bad idea, but i was trying to get it through their thick skulls that *we are humans, we dont play perfectly and we need help*

3 months have passed and a new preseason, still honor 1 "unlocked". 

Since being "reformed" is descided by the people you play with, and if they honor you or not, If you're stuck in a low ELO/MMR alongside people who tend to be more inflammatory (i.e mid bronze), you'll never climb OUT of low honor, so any 2nd offense is an instant demote to dishonorable.

2 minor penalties would screw you out of ranked. Minor penalties of which can be chalked up to human nature just being flawed.

So, let me just say that your idea should only work on people who have committed frequent and serious acts of toxicity, not just anyone labled dishonorable. Getting your 2nd and 3rd strikes get easier and easier as riot watches you more closely, trust me i've seen it happen myself.

A few things. First off, you passively progress in honor just by playing. Is it slow? Yes. But it happens.

And simply being human (i.e. flawed in personality) isn't enough to get you punished. One _warning_, in two years. And I'm no angel at all.

Please no... I just recently got banned (and by recently i mean months ago...) And i get honors every single game. Yet i'm still at honor lvl 0 It's been months of me getting at LEAST one honor per game, of course theres a few where i get none, and a few where i'm the most honored player on the team. No matter how much honor i get, i just don't ever get past honor lvl 0. It's ridiculous... and don't even get me started on the equally ridiculous reason for me being banned....
If you aren't leveling up in honor despite receiving commendations, that means you are also doing something that earns you reports.

Like playing a champion that people think is troll even though I perform well with it? Or deciding to split push and then my whole team dies twice in a row failing to fight under towers mid and they blame me when the other team ends the game because i don't port back to try and 1v5? People report me all the time for that. 

I have yet to get punished for those reports but I know people do it because they take the time to tell it to me with a nice passive aggressive :). Which of course prevents them from getting any punishment because ":)" = "friendly" by the report bots (and therefore Riots) standards.

But essentially you are telling me I can't progress in honor because people report me for playing off-meta?

The line between "trolling" and "off-meta" is, regretably, the same as the one between defeat and victory.
It is also quite reasonable to assume that even if by your own standards you are a fully reformed saint of an angel, others may not share your opinion.

I've been "stuck" on Honor 4 precisely because win or lose, I like to make sure to recognize the contribution of my allies to the end result: 
Sometimes that means getting an honor in return, other times it's a report for abuse.

Harassing, berating, and being consistently a dick to somebody because of their game play is toxic. In fact, that's why I got chat banned in the first place and moved to honor level 0, not for insulting or racial slurs or int feeding or trolling or verbal abuse, for criticizing my teammates playstyle too harshly.

But regardless I learned from that and now I keep my chat clean or positive.

But according to you it's ok to report me over my choice of champion and keep me at honor 0 regardless of the fact that I only put positive things or nothing in the chat. 

According to you If i pick something off meta and our team loses I'm trolling, regardless of how many tears of the goddess our adc built, how many mobis our toplaner built, regardless of the fact that I went positive K/D and did as much as I could to help our team win and get other lanes ahead.  The games all my fault because I'm not playing a meta champ. Therefore I'm trolling, deserve a report, deserve to be stuck at honor 0, and according to a lot of people in this thread, deserve to be banned from ranked games.

And all those people who played lulu top? or Ziggs botlane? or Lucian Mid? Ezreal or twitch jungle? Or Brand/ Annie Support?

I really really really really REALLY don't understand how people still get upset in this game when somebody picks something that "isn't meta". When are people going to get it? Probably never...

>But according to you it's ok to report me over my choice of champion and keep me at honor 0 regardless of the fact that I only put positive things or nothing in the chat.

That's a whole lot of insinuation.
All I'm doing is explaining what's happening: "Don't shoot the messenger."

Plus, nobody is ever as perfect as they think they are, Riot Support guys prove this every time someone "perfect" tries to appeal a permanent ban.

I disagree. I was level 3 and had a moment of weakness and was a total asshole to my team. I got my 2-week ban and realised my behavoir was just uncalled for and have been trying to get back into a positive mindset and not always get so angry at a video game. Reforming a player can happen, but it takes that player to understand they are the problem and they need to work on themselves and their communications. I have 0 honor at the moment and its a bit embarrassing, but I am working on not passing judgments and trying to get to a better rank.
